intro: Psychotria decora, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria decora is also noted for its potential medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
